title: Falkland Islands: Loss echoes across Argentina 40 years on
description: The war lasted two months and killed nearly 1,000 soldiers - more than 600 of whom were Argentinian.

title: Why you may have a thinking digital twin within a decade
description: Within 10 years people may be able to have a intelligent online version of themselves.

title: UK farmers turn to Nepal and Tajikistan for fruit pickers
description: No longer able to rely on workers from places like Ukraine, the UK is recruiting from further afield.

title: Africa Eye: Racism for sale
description: Africa Eye investigates a Chinese video-making industry which exploits children across Africa.

title: Scottish island airports then and now
description: Archive footage and recent film highlights the importance of island airports to Hebridean communities.

title: Ukraine war: Evidence shows widespread use of cluster munitions in Kharkiv
description: Russia has killed hundreds of civilians in Kharkiv with indiscriminate weapons, according to a new report.

title: Obituary: Phil Bennett elevated rugby to an art form
description: Phil Bennett, the legendary Wales and British and Irish Lions fly-half who elevated rugby union to an art form, dies at the age of 73.

title: Hilary Devey had charisma and ability, says Theo Paphitis
description: Former Dragon Theo Paphitis pays tribute to his co-star Hilary Devey, who has died aged 65.

title: Have a look inside Russia's new 'Tasty' McDonald's replacement
description: The new Russian brand is called "Vkusno i Tochka", which translates to "Tasty and that's it".

title: NI Protocol: UK override bill 'won't break international law'
description: The NI secretary says the bill and the government's legal advice will be published on Monday.

title: Pembrokeshire beach death: Rescuer Hywel Morgan 'a hero'
description: A woman who was on the beach says Hywel Morgan gave his life to "save others".

title: Rail strike: Agency staff could cover future disruption
description: The transport secretary says he is preparing to overhaul rules, as rail workers prepare to walk out.

title: England v New Zealand: Alex Lees reaches first Test half-century
description: England batter Alex Lees achieves his first Test half-century against New Zealand on day three of the second Test at Trent Bridge.

title: Grenfell's legacy: Should I 'stay put' if there's a fire in my tower block?
description: After it failed at Grenfell, why are people still being told to "stay put" in tower block fires?

title: Sturgeon must fire indyref2 starting gun now, says Salmond
description: Former first minister Alex Salmond calls for a referendum campaign to be mobilised now.

title: The Lady of Heaven film: Morocco bans ‘blasphemous’ British film
description: The Lady of Heaven film, about the daughter of prophet Muhammad, has sparked outrage.

title: Russia unveils 'tasty' McDonald's substitute
description: The fast food outlets are rebranded as "Tasty and that's it" after the burger giant pulled out.

title: Hajj-Muslim pilgrims face losing out from online booking to Mecca
description: The Saudi government wants Muslims to book online for Mecca but many have already paid tour agents.

title: Man v horse: Powys race won by runner Ricky Lightfoot
description: Ricky Lightfoot becomes the first runner in 15 years to beat horses over a 22-mile race.

title: Climate change a bigger threat than war, Fiji tells security summit
description: Its defence chief tells Asian partners that "devastating" climate change is his top security issue.

title: Small Somerset village hosts more than 30 Ukrainian refugees
description: Oakhill, in Somerset, has 750 residents and more than 10 families are hosting the refugees.

title: Circus ambition comes true for trapeze artist Trystan Chambers
description: How a boyhood dream to join the circus came true for trapeze artist Trystan Chambers.

title: The Gloucester shipwreck: Hopes part of royal wreck can be recovered
description: It is thought the stern of the warship, which sank in 1682, is "almost certainly intact".

title: Billie Eilish pauses London show over fan safety
description: The singer briefly halts her concert at the O2 arena after several fans pass out in the heat.
